title: Java StringequalsIgnoreCase()Method

metadata.description: Learn about Java StringequalsIgnoreCase()Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Compare strings to find out if they are equal, ignoring case differences:
String myStr1 = "Hello";
String myStr2 = "HELLO";
String myStr3 = "Another String";
System.out.println(myStr1.equalsIgnoreCase(myStr2)); // true
System.out.println(myStr1.equalsIgnoreCase(myStr3)); // false

Definition and Usage
The
equalsIgnoreCase()
method compares two strings, ignoring lower case and upper case differences.
This method returns true if the strings are equal, and false if not.
Tip:
Use the
compareToIgnoreCase()
method to compare two strings lexicographically, ignoring case differences.
Syntax
public boolean equalsIgnoreCase(String
anotherString
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
anotherString
A
String
, representing the other string 
    to be compared
Technical Details
Returns:
A
boolean
value:
true
- if the strings are equal, ignoring 
  case differences
false
- if the strings are not equal

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers Java StringequalsIgnoreCase()Method concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Java StringequalsIgnoreCase()Method effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Java StringequalsIgnoreCase()Method and how to apply it in your projects.
